intro: Renealmia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf renealmia, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its inflorescence consists of dense clusters of small, spike-like flowers that are usually pale green to brown in color. Renealmia angustifolia is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
